Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Throughout their history, NewAge Industries has consistently demonstrated their commitment to sustainability and environmental responsibility. Some notable practices they have implemented include:

1. Solar Power: For over six years, NewAge has utilized a solar power system with over 4,00 panels generating approximately one megawatt of electricity per year. This clean and sustainable energy source significantly reduces their reliance on traditional fossil fuels.
2. Zero Waste Initiative: NewAge has successfully transformed into a zero-waste organization by diverting all waste from landfills. They achieve this through various methods like recycling, repurposing materials, and participating in local waste management programs. Additionally, any non-recyclable waste is transported to an Energy-from-Waste (EfW) facility where metals are extracted and recycled, while the remaining waste is converted into energy through steam and electricity generation.
3. Electric Vehicle Charging Station: As part of their ongoing efforts to promote sustainable transportation, NewAge has installed a Level 2 electric vehicle charging station. This station can accommodate two vehicles simultaneously and plans for additional stations are in place to meet future demand.
4. Renovations & Upgrades: During building renovations, NewAge has implemented numerous sustainable practices, including improving insulation, installing high-efficiency lighting systems, and incorporating water conservation measures. These upgrades contribute to reduced energy consumption and overall resource efficiency.

source.content: for additional Quality Department needs While many of the improvements in the updated sustainability report relate to these renovations others are simply part of the company’s ongoing focus of being a responsible corporate partner and good neighbor “It took a lot of effort to make all of these changes happen” said Baker “Yes it would be easier to throw all of our trash away and let it end up in a landfill It would also be easier to keep using our inefficient old lighting and to tell our customers ‘Sorry the power’s out we can’t help you’ during outages But none of that is good for the environment our relationships or our bottom line We’ve chosen to take a stand and become an example” Baker also notes that part of NewAge’s sustainability involves its status as an employee-owned ESOP organization Employee ownership allows for better employee retention and continuity while it lessens competitors’ interest and opportunities for mergers or acquisitions The pride of ownership helps

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: Are there any events or initiatives focused on environmental conservation? If yet then list 10 such events.
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Yes, there have been several events and initiatives focused on environmental conservation at NewAge Industries. Here are some notable examples from the provided information:

1. Solar Power: NewAge Industries has been utilizing solar power for over six years, generating a megawatt of electricity per year, and reducing their reliance on fossil fuels (Source: Unknown).
2. Renovation Expansion: The ongoing building renovations aim to expand production and warehousing for the AdvantaPure® brand while incorporating environmentally friendly features like efficient lighting, HVAC systems, and recycled materials (Unknown Source).
3. Zero Waste Achievement: In September 202, NewAge Industries announced that they had become a zero-waste organization, demonstrating a strong commitment to minimize waste and promote a circular economy (Unknown Source).
4. Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR): NewAge Industries has consistently shown dedication to corporate social responsibility through various initiatives, including sustainable practices, community involvement, and charitable giving (Unknown Source).
5. Donation of Laptops to Cambodian School: In December 202, NewAge Industries donated six laptop computers to the Caramanico School in Ratanakiri, Cambodia, supporting education and local development in a sustainable manner (Unknown Source).

While specific numbers or dates may not be available for all events and initiatives, it is clear that NewAge Industries places a strong emphasis on environmental conservation and sustainable practices.

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, NewAge Industries has made several public commitments to social and corporate responsibility. They have published two editions of their Sustainability Reports, showcasing their continuous dedication to environmental stewardship, social responsibility, and economic performance. Additionally, they hold the prestigious Certified B Corporation™ status, which recognizes companies that meet rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency.

NewAge Industries and the AdvantaPure® and Verigenics® brands maintain Certified B Corporation™ status from B Lab a nonprofit organization that verifies businesses leading global economic change to benefit people and the planet This achievement is evidence of our corporate responsibility and the high standards we meet in performance legal accountability and public transparency Through a detailed application process B Lab assessed the impact NewAge and its brands have on our employees customers community and environment to award our certification By balancing profit and purpose we join thousands of other businesses around the globe to redefine business success and create a more inclusive sustainable economy NewAge is the only Certified B Corporation in the fluid transfer systems industry which sets us apart from other manufacturers of plastic and rubber tubing reinforced hose and molded single-use components As a  employee-owned company NewAge is proud to be a purpose-driven B Corp

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Are there annual or quarterly reports detailing these commitments? If yes, then summarize.
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, NewAge Industries publishes an annual sustainability report that details the company's environmental social and governance (ESG) commitments and progress towards achieving them. This report provides transparency about the initiatives undertaken by the company to minimize its impact on the environment and contribute positively to society. Some key areas covered in the report include energy efficiency waste reduction community engagement and employee wellbeing. By publishing these reports regularly, NewAge demonstrates its dedication to continuous improvement and maintaining open communication with stakeholders.

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result: Based on the provided context, it appears that there is a company offering various products, services, and technologies related to different industries such as food processing, refrigeration, air supply, sight gauges, slurry handling, spray systems, vacuum lines, water fluid lines, wet or dry food processing, and many more. Some specific examples mentioned include high-temperature ovens and fryers, food processing machinery, filling and packaging equipment, point-of-sale machines for milkshakes, slushies, and other ice beverages, and NewAge tubing used in these applications. To get a comprehensive list of their offerings, please reach out to them directly using the contact information provided.

Commerce & Products.question: What are the key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce?
Commerce & Products.result:
There are multiple key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce. Some of these include:

1. Partners in Education: Connects businesses like NewAge Industries with local high schools to provide education on various aspects of business, such as career development, interviewing skills, and more.
2. Local schools and sports associations/musical groups: Collaboration between these organizations and businesses like NewAge Industries often involves providing financial support through advertisements placed in event programs. This not only helps the kids but also serves as a form of marketing for the supporting businesses.
3. Educational institutions (e.g., University of Pennsylvania, Penn State University): These partnerships may involve hiring recent graduates or offering internships to students, allowing them to gain valuable work experience and potentially leading to future employment opportunities.
4. Global consulting firms and technology companies: Collaborating with these organizations can help NewAge Industries stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and innovative solutions.
5. Other businesses within the same industry or niche: Networking and collaboration among peers can lead to joint ventures, shared resources, and mutual growth opportunities.

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employment or educational opportunities are currently available?
Employment & Opportunities.result: Based on the provided information, there are several employment and educational opportunities available. For students, NewAge Industries partners with Partners in Education, connecting businesses like NewAge with local high schools. This collaboration brings real-world business experiences into the classroom for students to learn about careers, job fields, and the challenges of running a business. Additionally, Hatboro-Horsham High School offers the Bridges internship program targeted towards junior and senior students. This program assists students in deciding on college courses by providing them with hands-on experience through internships. Interns at NewAge Industries also benefit from meeting regularly with CEO Ken Baker and department leaders, as well as spending time with various team members to learn about different job responsibilities and requirements.

Employment & Opportunities.question: Are there any events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, or training programs? If yes, list them.
Employment & Opportunities.result:
Yes, there are events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, and training programs available for students and professionals interested in NewAge Industries and related industries. Some of these events include:

1. Job Fairs: NewAge participates in job fairs organized by local high schools, colleges, and universities. These events provide an excellent opportunity for students and recent graduates to explore careers in various industries, including those offered by NewAge.
2. Webinars: From time to time, NewAge conducts webinars on relevant topics such as industry trends, career development, and technical skills. These webinars are open to students, educators, and professionals who want to stay updated and improve their knowledge in their respective fields.
3. Workshops: NewAge occasionally organizes workshops focused on specific areas of expertise within the company. These workshops aim to enhance the skills of current employees while providing valuable learning experiences for students considering careers in similar fields.
4. Training Programs: In collaboration with Partners in Education and other organizations, NewAge offers training programs designed to help students develop essential skills needed for success in their chosen careers. These programs may cover topics such as problem-solving, communication, and teamwork.

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employee or participant benefits are highlighted?
Employment & Opportunities.result:
Several employee/participant benefits are highlighted in the given text. These include:

1. Wealth creation through ESOP (Employee Stock Ownership Plan) growth, which can lead to financial security during retirement years.
2. Sense of ownership among employees due to their participation in the ESOP, leading to increased engagement, commitment, and pride in their work.
3. Succession planning for the organization, ensuring continuity and stability in leadership.
4. Improved customer experience, as employees feel more invested and connected to their roles, ultimately translating to better communication and service.

source.content: more than ever” Another customer benefit resulting from the ESOP is that it sets up a succession plan for the organization Many of today’s international conglomerates become larger by acquiring small companies Plants are often closed and production is moved offshore The knowledge and talent of those employees is lost as they find jobs in other industries Baker wanted to avoid that possibility and at the same time help secure a future for the NewAge brands and their employees Interested in becoming an employee owner View our current job openings here Share your needs with us and we’ll be in touch soon

Southampton PA — On Monday May 14 Pennsylvania Governor Tom Wolf visited plastic tubing manufacturer NewAge Industries located in Southampton Bucks County Pa Governor Wolf was invited by Ken Baker NewAge’s CEO for discussions on the company’s employee ownership program and a tour of the newly-expanded facility NewAge’s ESOP — Employee Stock Ownership Plan — has seen tremendous growth since it was established in  In fact the company’s stock price has risen over  since the plan’s inception The ESOP owns 49 of NewAge via shares of stock and was established to motivate and reward employees It is a benefit that addresses income inequality by building wealth for employee-owners’ retirement years even when wages may not be growing significantly NewAge offers a k retirement savings program but many of the company’s employee-owners will tell you that their ESOP account growth has far surpassed their k performance An ESOP also offers an option for business owners who wish to avoid selling to

of the company For customers it also means that you are dealing with an owner every time you contact NewAge and we take that seriously Since the inception of the ESOP NewAge has continued to grow and prosper This employee ownership success has had a beneficial effect on the morale attitude and future retirement of NewAge Industries’ employee-owners NewAge built its solid reputation by providing a high level of customer support and service along with superior products The ESOP lets employees expand upon that by allowing them to take true ownership of their positions Baker says “When a customer calls they speak with an owner The employees’ jobs are part of an investment in their future and that’s reflected in their communications with customers and suppliers and with each other now more than ever” Another customer benefit resulting from the ESOP is that it sets up a succession plan for the organization Many of today’s international conglomerates become larger by acquiring small

Financials & Funding.question: What financial or funding goals have been set for the next period?
Financials & Funding.result: It seems there are several financial milestones for NewAge Industries in the near future. One goal is to achieve full ownership by the ESOP (Employee Stock Ownership Plan) within the next few years. By 202, the ESOP will own 49% of the company, making employees 40% owners. Additionally, it appears that NewAge plans to continue expanding their operations through acquisitions and facility expansions. For instance, they recently purchased a second facility within seven miles of their corporate headquarters, further increasing their production capabilities. Furthermore, the company has shown dedication to sustainability initiatives and alternative energy sources, such as installing solar panels on their headquarters. While specific financial targets related to these endeavors may not be directly mentioned, it can be inferred that NewAge is committed to investing in growth opportunities while maintaining a focus on environmental responsibility.

Research & Innovation.question: Are there any ongoing or upcoming research projects or innovation initiatives? If yes then list them
Research & Innovation.result:
Based on the provided information, it seems that NewAge Industries is actively pursuing various research projects and innovation initiatives. Some notable examples include:

1. Expansion into new markets (e.g., high purity pharmaceutical and biopharm industries) through the establishment of AdvantaPure.
2. Development of single-use options such as manifold manifold connections and BioClosure® stopper assemblies specifically designed for the biopharm industry.
3. Launch of Verigenics®, which provides innovative solutions using radio frequency identification (RFID) technology for tracking and authentication purposes.
4. Continued investment in renewable energy sources by installing solar panels on their headquarters building, demonstrating a commitment to sustainability.

These initiatives showcase NewAge Industries' dedication to innovation and growth while addressing the evolving needs of their diverse client base.

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What organizations, institutions, or entities is the organization collaborating with?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
NewAge Industries collaborates with several organizations, institutions, and entities to achieve its goals and give back to the community. Some of these include:

1. Partners in Education - Connects businesses with local high schools to provide education resources and career development opportunities.
2. Local high schools - Ken Baker, the CEO of NewAge Industries, visits these schools to discuss business ethics, career development, and interviewing skills.
3. Area's two high schools - NewAge Industries' CEO Ken Baker communicates with students and teachers to share his knowledge and expertise.
4. Athletic teams of local schools - NewAge frequently provides financial support to these teams through advertisements placed in event programs.
5. Sports associations and school-sponsored musical groups - NewAge also supports these organizations by providing financial assistance through advertising.
6. Nonprofit associations - NewAge Industries works with nonprofits locally, nationally, and internationally to make a positive impact on communities around the world.
7. Public television stations - NewAge contributes to organizations like public television stations to promote education and cultural enrichment.
8. Scholarship funds - The company supports scholarship funds to help students access higher education.
9. Toys for Tots program - Team members at NewAge Industries participate in this program, run by the US Marine Corps Reserve, to provide holiday gifts and hope to less fortunate children in the community.

These collaborations allow NewAge Industries to engage with diverse organizations and individuals, fostering growth and learning for all parties involved.

value support of technology-enabled business transformations across the end-to-end value chain and a strong network throughout the Life Science and Healthcare community As a technology-savvy strategic business leader Terry has broad experience including corporate strategy MA product development marketing  sales production and distribution He has combined this business areas focus with hands-on leadership in key enabling capabilities such as ERP IT advanced analytics real-world evidence cyber risk management and digital capabilities Terry also spent several years on the Advisory Board of a publicly traded venture capital firm where he supported the evaluation of companies for capital deployment and mentored leadership in the portfolio companies from investment through successful exits which including this firm’s minority position exceeded 16 B This broad set of experiences enables him to quickly contribute and bring comprehensive holistic perspectives and guidance to both management

business and policy matters As a thought leader he led programs on innovative topics such as the Future of Health the Future of Work Digitization of Healthcare and other contemporary topics Terry is a private C-Level Consultant an advisor to both public and high-quality Venture Capital and Private Equity-backed companies a Trustee of LaSalle College High School in Philadelphia and a Board Member  General Manager of the Yarmouth-Dennis Red Sox of the Cape Cod Baseball League Terry has a BS in Engineering from the Pennsylvania State University a MS in Organizational Dynamics from the University of Pennsylvania is a graduate of the Executive Leadership Program at the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania and the Board Director Leadership Governance Program at Drexel University’s LeBow College of Business Share your needs with us and we’ll be in touch soon
